PBOT Bridge #007, N Willamette Blvd semi-viaduct was built in 1941, and currently stands at 74 years old! Normal bridge service life is 75 years, so it’s close to it replacement age. The bridge is classified by the Federal NBI as structurally deficient, and is weight restricted to less than legal trucks by PBOT. The bridge is located on an Emergency Response Route. The weight restriction could delay the response time of Fire Trucks which exceed the weight limit. Interestingly the bridge does not

properties.Project_Name: Broadway Drive Wall E of House #980, SW
properties.Project_Description: Retaining wall #128 is located adjacent 980 SW Broadway Drive. The wall is approximately 80 feet long x maximum height of 8 feet. There is no recorded age for the wall, but it does appear to be in excess of 50-60 years old. It was built using broken chunks of concrete sidewalk, which is absolutely not a recommended type of retaining wall. The wall is in significant danger of failing, and is already significantly leaning forward away from plumb.  At mid length the wall supports 8 feet of retained

PBOT Bridge #033, NE Glisan at 90th Ave was built in 1911, and currently stands at 104 years old! Normal bridge service life is 75 years. The bridge is classified by the Federal NBI as functionally obsolete, and is weight restricted to legal trucks by PBOT. This means that heavy freight cannot use the bridge and must detour around for access to and from I-84. Glisan is currently Classified as a Preferred City Truck Route, but at this location it is weight restricted. The bridge is also located o

properties.Project_Name: Taylor’s Ferry Rd Rockslide Abatement, SW
properties.Project_Description: In 2002 large boulders were shown to be spilling out of a rock slope outcrop west of Fulton Park Blvd intersection along Taylors Ferry Road. The boulders had spilled into the roadway and were a significant threat to the safety of drivers. Concrete barriers were placed in the roadway to help contain the spill, which effectively reduced this two lane section of west bound Taylors Ferry Rd to a one lane section. These barriers are still in place today as boulders have continued to fall since then.

Stabilize the Johnson Creek channel to limit excessive erosion around the sewer pipe, create fish habitat; create constructed wetlands and enhance existing wetlands for flood storage and water quality benefits; and protect an existing bridge structure.
Improve the performance of the existing WQF located on SE Platt Ave. within Mckinley Estates.  This is an in-house construction project.
Construct the SW 86th Ave pump station & appurtenances to expand the Fanno Creek Basin System pumping capacity to a minimum firm pumping capacity of 47-cfs (~21,000-gpm).

The objective is to better control, and treat stormwater from the parking lot before it gets to the inlet and drains to the Willamette River.

Retrofit/replace the Boones Ferry Culvert on Tryon Creek to increase capacity and provide fish passage.  The project will include channel enhancement work to control the grade of the creek and protect streambanks and will protect an exposed 18-inch sewer line crossing the creek approximately 145 feet upstream of the culvert.  In addition to limiting fish passage, the pipe is also in need of repair and it does not convey water consistent with BES stormwater design manual standards.
Construct a replacement for the 45th Ave culvert on Fanno Creek to increase capacity and provide fish passage.

Expand secondary treatment capacity at CBWTP  consistent with the National Pollution Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit for operating the plant.  This project will add two new secondary clarifiers per the recommended phasing in the 1995 Facilities Plan and 2009 update.
Extend the existing wet weather outfall diffuser to alleviate sediment accumulation in outfall pipe.

Objective: The goal of this project is to provide a functioning condensate sump that conveys condensate to the booster pump station wet well, and prevents condensate from overflowing from the sump and entering the stormwater system or infiltrating the ground. The current system does not have an appropriate chemical/solids handling pump, and often overflows.

This project will plan, design and construct a replacement of the Greenleaf pump station at the existing site. Flow upgrades will render Penridge tank superfluous and will be demolished in this project as well. The new pump station will pump directly to the distribution system.

The project planned, designed and constructed a new buried reservoir to replace open Reservoir 3. This project was one solution toward compliance with LT2 replacement of the open reservoirs. It is assumed that Reservoir 4 will be used as the overflow detention, dechlorination and stormwater structure. We envision that the buried reservoir would be topped with a reflecting pond and historical features would be protected as much as possible.

properties.Project_Description: This project will install 20 feet of 16 inch steel casing pipe, replace 80 feet of 8-inch ductile iron pipe, lower and sleeve one water service line, and renew two water service lines.

properties.Project_Name: SW Boones Ferry Rd at SW Arnold St Bridge
properties.Project_Description: This project will abandon two parallel 6-inch cast iron water mains in SW Boones Ferry Rd between SW Comus Ct and SW Arnold St (approximate 800 feet). Replace with one 460-foot long 8-inch ductile iron water main, attaching the 8-inch pipe to a 125.5 foot long new bridge structure. Renew two water service lines.

properties.Project_Name: NE Prescott from I205  to 102nd Ave
properties.Project_Description: This project will relocate five (5) water meters and relocate four (4) fire hydrants (renewal of 1 or more hydrants may be necessary).

This project will construct a new monitoring well to replace existing well PWB-1-USG, which has become deformed and possibly cracked, and has a long sample tube lodged within it that cannot be removed. A small sampling pump will be installed in the well. The existing monitoring well will be sealed & abandoned.

Investigate approximately 8 total miles of smaller sections of Conduit 3 that are located in highly vulnerable areas; record findings from the investigation; identify limits of damaged sections; and prepare reports that recommend strategies for addressing the defects found from the investigation

properties.Project_Name: DS - NE Alderwood Rd at NE 79th Ct

Add air conditioning equipment to provide cooling for the 23 ft by 51 ft sodium hypochlorite storage room within the Chemical Building.

his project will grind existing pavement, restore road subgrade, pave, and stripe 2 miles of Road 10. The road will be brought up to current standards, using fill and walls to add an average of 2 feet of width to the segment. Approximately 10 culverts will be replaced with aluminum alloy pipe.

This project will design and construct an ammonia treatment system, corrosion control system, chlorine system improvements, two new booster pumps, and electrical upgrades at the Vivian site.  Upgrade the SCADA and instrumentation systems and two motor control centers .

properties.Project_Name: NE 33rd Ave and Siskiyou St Main Break
